results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 11
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: The construction of Britain’s new V.C.10 jet liner and its test flight to Ghana; the Amateur Boxing International in Dublin; Beekeeping in Australia; The Overseas Film School in Britain where students learn the techniques of film production; Art exhibitions in London by Indian children and Ceylonese adults; A gala concert given by the Ceylonese High Commissioner, Dr Malalesekera, in London; Motor racing on ice in Canada.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 10

results.title: Commonwealth prime ministers in Britain
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Geof Sherley
results.brief_description: The visit to Britain in 1960 of the Commonwealth Prime Ministers. Includes the then Prime Minister of Australia, Sir Robert Menzies and his wife Dame Patti.

results.title: Commonwealth of Nations
results.brief_description: The nature, extent and constitution of the British Commonwealth - its purpose, benefits derived from it and the relationship among its members. The historical background is presented, beginning 200 years ago when British colonies were scattered in newly discovered lands all over the world. The seed of the Commonwealth was germinated when Canada was granted her independence. Contains historical footage of 1950s Sydney.

results.title: Commonwealth Meeting, 1965
results.brief_description: Marlborough House in London was the scene of the Commonwealth Prime Ministers Conference, June 1965. A Commonwealth Peace Mission to end the war in Vietnam was the main topic discussed. Prime Ministers took the opportunity of fulfilling other engagements - Mr Holyoake saw a test cricket match between England and New Zealand; Sir Robert Menzies attended a ceremony commemorating the signing of the Magna Carta 750 years ago; all attended a dinner party at 10 Downing Street.

results.title: Commonwealth Journey [Edited Version]
results.brief_description: A record of the 1959 Commonwealth Tour of the Duke of Edinburgh, compiled film coverage of India, Pakistan, Brunei, North Borneo, Hong Kong, the British Solomon Islands, the Gilbert and Ellice Islands, Christmas Island, the Bahamas and Bermuda.
